article.headline: Marist 67, St. Peter's 58
article.story: POUGHKEEPSIE, N.Y. (AP) -- Will Whittington had 18 points to lead Marist in a 67-58 win over St. Peter's Tuesday night. James Smith added 12 points and 9 rebounds and Ryan Stilphen contributed 10 points for Marist (15-5, 7-2 Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference). Akeem Gooding led St. Peter's (3-16, 1-8) with 22 points, while Kevin Spann and Todd Sowell had 11 points each and Brandon Brock added 10. Marist jumped into the lead early on, going up by as much as 21 points (27-6) on a jumper by Kaylen Gregory. Saint Peter's came back in the second half, gradually trimming the Marist lead the entire second half to pull the score within five at 51-46 on a free throw by Sowell with six minutes to play. Jordan notched a 3-point play on the next possession to keep the Peacocks at bay and seal the win. Marist outshot the Peacocks with a 47.1 percent average, compared to St. Peter's 43.8 percent average.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
